name: indemnification
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
finance & economics
  formal or specialized the act of paying or promising to pay someone an amount of money if they suffer damage or loss: They asked for some form of indemnification in case the proposed deal was blocked. The government has allocated large sums for the indemnification of farmers whose crops are destroyed.
law
  specialized the act of protecting someone against legal responsibility for their actions: All of our employees receive indemnification against legal action. Before I will say anything, I want full indemnification. See
indemnify
More examplesFewer examplesMy clients are seeking indemnification for damage to their health suffered during the course of their employment. An indemnification clause allows the sale to be cancelled if the picture turns out to be a fake.Her employer signed an indemnification agreement, promising to pay any fines imposed by the courts.
